quotes.quote: When a man wants to murder a tiger he calls it sport. When a tiger wants to murder him he calls it ferocity.
Those who foolishly sought power by riding the back of the tiger ended up inside.
It is not part of a true culture to tame tigers, any more than it is to make sheep ferocious.
An infallible method of conciliating a tiger is to allow oneself to be devoured.
The long run puts the tiger in the cat.
Young normal tigers do not eat people. If eaten by a tiger you may rest assured he was abnormal.
No man can tame a tiger into a kitten by stroking it.
When two tigers fight, one is certain to be maimed, and one to die.
A tiger does not proclaim his tigritude, he pounces.
The tiger will never lie down with the lamb. He acknowledges no pact that is not reciprocal. The lamb must learn to run with the tigers.
Better to live one year as a tiger, then a hundred as sheep.
The tiger lies low not from fear, but for aim.
The tigers of wrath are wiser than the horses of instruction.
A tiger never returns to his prey he did not finish off.
Tiger watches and hunts; whereas, hyenas wait and wait, for their time, to reach rubbish left by the tiger; similarly, the fools wait, not the wise ones.

The tiger’s world, by contrast, is not only amoral but peculiarly consequence-free, and this-the atavistic certainty that there is nothing more lethal than itself-is the apex predator’s greatest weakness
The tiger will see you a hundred times before you see him once.
A tiger does not ignore or slight any small animal. The way he catches a mouse and catches and devours a cow are the same.
Tiger father begets tiger son.
The tiger is humbled by memories of prey.
A tiger does not shout its tigritude, it acts.
A tiger keeps no friends. It's too dangerous.
A wounded tiger is a dangerous beast.
